messages.subject: Re: Donkey Konga
messages.msgSnippet: I got Jungle Beat for Mother s Day which isn t about playing to the music, instead it uses the kongo s as the controller.  Simon and Linnaea and I really enjoy
messages.messageBody:
I got Jungle Beat for Mother's Day which isn't about playing to the
music, instead it uses the kongo's as the controller. Simon and
Linnaea and I really enjoy it. It's gotten even more use than the
Donkey Konga game.

Schuyler

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Donkey Konga
messages.msgSnippet: Oh totally cool! We ll check that out! We ve had HOURS of fun with the first one. Thanks Sandra, Jacki, tapping her foot and bouncing just thinking about it
messages.messageBody:
Oh totally cool! We'll check that out! We've had HOURS of fun with the first
one.

Thanks Sandra,

Jacki, tapping her foot and bouncing just thinking about it

-----Original Message-----
From: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of SandraDodd@...
Sent: Friday, June 03, 2005 5:19 PM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Donkey Konga



In a message dated 6/3/2005 4:46:40 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
jacki@... writes:

Holly and I got into a
rambunctious Donkey Conga game that resulted in my family's Xmas purchase
of
it (yay!).


OH! We got Donkey Konga 2.
The songs aren't as good (by "good" I mean songs I know and like <g>), but
there are a couple of very good games, and you spend the points you make to
play the games. Also, points can be made with two players together. So
two
players can play a cooperative game, make points, and then go and play a
game-within-the-game together.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Donkey Konga
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/3/2005 4:46:40 PM Mountain Daylight Time, jacki@boardprep.net writes: Holly  and I got into a rambunctious Donkey Conga game that resulted
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/3/2005 4:46:40 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
jacki@... writes:

Holly and I got into a
rambunctious Donkey Conga game that resulted in my family's Xmas purchase of
it (yay!).


OH! We got Donkey Konga 2.
The songs aren't as good (by "good" I mean songs I know and like <g>), but
there are a couple of very good games, and you spend the points you make to
play the games. Also, points can be made with two players together. So two
players can play a cooperative game, make points, and then go and play a
game-within-the-game together.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
